name: Marcus Miller
description: '''William Henry Marcus Miller Jr.''' (born June 14, 1959) is an American musician, songwriter, and record producer. He has worked with trumpeter [[Miles Davis]], pianist [[Herbie Hancock]], singer [[Luther Vandross]], and saxophonists [[Wayne Shorter]] and [[David Sanborn]], among others. He was the main songwriter and producer on three of Davis' albums: ''[[Tutu (album)|Tutu]]'' (1986), ''[[Music from Siesta]]'' (1987), and ''[[Amandla (album)|Amandla]]'' (1989). His collaboration with Vandross was especially close; he co-produced and served as the arranger for most of Vandross' albums, and he and Vandross co-wrote many of Vandross' songs, including the hits "[[I Really Didn't Mean It]]", "[[Any Love (Luther Vandross song)|Any Love]]", "[[Power of Love/Love Power]]" and "[[Don't Want to Be a Fool]]". He also co-wrote the 1988 single "[[Da Butt]]" for [[Experience Unlimited]].
